name: One-ovz-driver
body:
### Welcome to OpenNebula driver for OpenVZ hypervisor

This set of drivers allows you to use [OpenVZ](http://wiki.openvz.org/Main_Page) as a hypervisor to deploy virtual machines in [OpenNebula](http://opennebula.org). 

### Description

One-ovz-driver consists of IM_MAD scripts that are able to monitor the remote hosts and a VMM_MAD scripts to deploy and manage Virtual Machines. VMM_MAD serie's scripts make use of [OpenVZ API](https://github.com/dchrzascik/ruby-openvz)

### Benefits 

Extending OpenNebula system by including a well known container-based virtualization for Linux - OpenVZ.

### Cluster Node requirements
1. ruby >= 1.9
 * rvm is recommended to manage ruby version
 * ex. rvm [tutorial for centos 6](http://blog.jeffcosta.com/2011/07/22/install-ruby-version-manager-rvm-on-centos-6/)

2. rake
 * should be available by default, if not then install them manually

```
$ gem install rake
```

3. remaining gems

```
$rake gems
```
